generated_text: "Module 11: Python" is an 81-minute intermediate lab. Practice writing Python scripts, using variables, and control structures. Apply functions and modules to real-world problems. Hands-on exercises will reinforce concepts, such as data types and file input/output. By the end of this lab, you will be able to write and execute Python programs, demonstrating improved coding skills.

mcqs.question: What is the primary focus of Module 11: Python?
What will you be able to do by the end of this lab?
options: Design and implement machine learning models

flashcards.back: Used to store and manipulate data in Python
Used to control the flow of a program's execution, such as if-else statements and loops
Reusable blocks of code that perform a specific task
